marketNews.title: Snips Recap 2024: Another Year of Conglomerates
marketNews.content: Indonesia's capital market in 2024 was again dominated by corporate actions from several conglomerates, accompanied by spectacular stock price gains of issuers affiliated with those conglomerates. This trend was observed in several conglomerates, such as Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan), Agoes Projosasmito, Prajogo Pangestu (Grup Barito and Petrindo), Grup Thohir, Grup Lippo, and Grup MNC. Below are the details of corporate actions and stock returns during 2024 held by those conglomerates:

marketNews.title: Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan)
marketNews.content:
Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI): +227%
  - August: conducted a private placement of IDR 6.5 trillion to acquire 239 hectares of land from an affiliated party.
  - December: announced the IPO of its subsidiary (CBDK) with a target fund raise of approximately IDR 1.7‑2.3 trillion.
Return of stocks affiliated with the Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan) conglomerate: INPC +193%, JIHD +214%.

marketNews.title: Agoes Projosasmito
marketNews.content:
Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN): +29%
  - September: inaugurated a smelter worth IDR 21 trillion with an input capacity of 900,000 tonnes of concentrate per year in West Nusa Tenggara.
Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS): +104%
  - December: announced higher grade gold reserves at the River Reef and Hill Reel mines in Palu.
Bumi Resources (BUMI): +39%
  - April: planned to seek approval for a quasi‑reorganization to eliminate a US$2.35 billion retained earnings deficit for 2023. The plan was later removed from the agenda of the extraordinary shareholders meeting in June 2024.

marketNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu (PP)
marketNews.content:
Petrosea (PTRO): +426%
  - June: CUAN, through its subsidiary PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, increased its ownership by 7.5% of PTRO shares valued at approximately IDR 207.9 million from PT Caraka Reksa Optima.
  - December: approved a stock split with a 1:10 ratio, with the new nominal value trading on the regular market and negotiations scheduled for 3 January 2025.
Barito Renewables Energy (BREN): +24%
  - May: the IDX set BREN trading to be conducted via a full periodic call auction (FCA).
  - September: entered the FTSE Global Equity Series – Large Cap index, but was later removed due to concentrated ownership, with four shareholders controlling 97% of the company. (https://stockbit.com/post/15819527)
Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA): +43%
  - May: announced that its joint venture with Glencore plc signed an agreement to acquire all shares of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore (SECP) from Shell Singapore Pte. Ltd.
  - May: entered the MSCI Global Standard Indexes.
  - August: TPIA Director Suryandi said the company is opening the opportunity to list its infrastructure subsidiary PT Chandra Daya Investasi.
Return of stocks affiliated with the Prajogo Pangestu conglomerate: CUAN -17%, BRPT -31%.

marketNews.title: Grup Lippo
marketNews.content: September: LPKR, through its subsidiary PT Megapratama Karya Persada, sold approximately 18.6% of SILO shares to Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. for about IDR 6.9 trillion.\nReturn of stocks affiliated with Grup Lippo: MLPT +1,078%, MLPL +30%, and LPKR +5%.

marketNews.title: Grup MNC
marketNews.content:
September: became an investor in a private placement of RAAM, acquiring 619.4 million (10%) shares valued at about IDR 310 million.
October: MSIN performed a stock split with a 1:5 ratio.
December: KPIG reached an agreement to divest the MNC Bali Resort land assets in Bali to PT Bumi Indah Prima for IDR 5.5 trillion.
Return of stocks affiliated with Grup MNC: KPIG +140%, MSIN +40%.

marketNews.title: Grup Sinar Mas
marketNews.content: July: DSSA performed a stock split with a 1:10 ratio.\nReturn of stocks affiliated with Grup Sinarmas: DSSA +363%, GEMS +83%.

marketNews.title: Grup Thohir
marketNews.content: September: ADRO announced it would spin off its thermal coal business under AADI through a shareholders' public offering (PUPS). Simultaneously, AADI also conducted an IPO in December 2024. (https://e-ipo.co.id/id/pipeline/get-propectus-file?id=319&type=summary)\nReturn of stocks affiliated with Grup Thohir: ADRO +2.1%, AADI +44%, ADMR -12%, TRIM +26%, and ESSA +53%.

marketNews.title: Corporate Actions Q1 2024
marketNews.content:
January
  - RAJA: through its subsidiary acquired an 8% participating interest in the Jabung block from PT GPI Jabung.
  - KARW: PT Saranakelola Investa purchased 80.19% of KARW shares from ICTSI Far East Limited Pte. Ltd. for about IDR 31 million. KARW was renamed Meratus Jasa Prima in May 2024.
February
  - INCO: state‑owned mining holding MIND ID acquired 14% of INCO shares at IDR 3,050 per share.
  - WIKA: reached a master restructuring agreement worth IDR 24.79 trillion.
  - GGRM: through its subsidiary obtained a 50‑year toll road concession for the Kediri‑Tulungagung corridor, targeted to start operations in Q3 2025.
March
  - UNTR: through its subsidiary plans to acquire geothermal company PT Supreme Energy Rantau Dedap for US$80.69 million.
  - FORU: IMR Asia Holding acquired 77.7% of FORU shares for IDR 45.29 million.
  - The Minister of State‑Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, announced a consolidation of BUMN Karya from seven companies into three, with the surviving entities being ADHI, PTPP, and PT Hutama Karya. The consolidation has not yet been realized, although it was initially planned to be completed by October 2024.
  - EMTK: through its subsidiary plans to acquire 41.15% of CASS shares for IDR 704.1 million. The transaction was completed in April 2024.

marketNews.title: Corporate Actions Q2 2024
marketNews.content:
April
  - HRUM: through its subsidiary acquired 51% of Blue Sparkling Energy, a developer of an HPAL smelter to be operational in 2026, for approximately US$206.2 million. HRUM also signed a memorandum of understanding for strategic cooperation with Eternal Tsingshan Group Ltd.
  - SSIA: BYD announced the purchase of 108 hectares of land in the Subang Smartpolitan industrial area owned by SSIA. Previously, BYD launched its products in Indonesia in early 2024.
May
  - Starlink obtained a license to operate in Indonesia as an internet service provider for retail consumers.
June
  - PYFA: through its subsidiary acquired all shares of Probiotec Limited for approximately AU$251 million, partially financed by a rights issue of about IDR 1 trillion in April 2024 and the remainder through bank debt.

marketNews.title: Corporate Actions Q3 2024
marketNews.content:
July
  - TOWR: through its subsidiary acquired 90.11% of IBST for IDR 3.42 trillion.
  - JSMR: divested 35% of PT Jasamarga Transjawa Tol for US$960.3 million to a consortium of Metro Pacific Tollways Corp and GIC Pte. Ltd.
  - DOID: through its business entity acquired the anthracite mining company Atlantic Carbon Group for US$122.4 million.
  - TPMA: acquired 65% of PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah from an affiliate for US$32.5 million, part of a rights issue of IDR 406.5 million in July 2024.
  - VinFast started groundbreaking a US$200 million plant in Subang, targeted to operate in Q4 2025.
  - TOTL: Shimizu Corporation launched a voluntary tender offer for 19.9% of TOTL shares; no further update has been provided.
  - BKSL: Genting Plantations Bhd. planned to purchase 152 hectares of land from BKSL and a third party for about IDR 2 trillion.
August
  - BSDE: planned to acquire 91.99% of SMDM for about IDR 2.4 trillion, with the transaction expected to close in October 2024.
  - DOID: through its subsidiary acquired 5.07% of 29Metals Ltd. for approximately AU$12.5 million.
  - FILM: planned to acquire 80.05% of NETV for about IDR 1.7 trillion, with the transaction expected to close in October 2024.
  - BNBR: completed a quasi‑reorganization to eliminate an equity deficit of IDR 19.5 trillion.
  - ACES: did not renew the licensing agreement with Ace Hardware Corporation, which will expire on 31 December 2024.
  - LABA: explored cooperation with electric motor manufacturer ECGO and planned to invest in land and buildings covering approximately 40 hectares.

marketNews.title: Corporate Actions Q4 2024
marketNews.content:
October
  - LEAD: conducted a private placement to convert US$20 million of debt.
  - ENRG: through its subsidiary signed an acquisition agreement for a 51% participation right in the Sengkang Block, South Sulawesi.
  - ANTM: through its subsidiary acquired 30% of the Tsingshan Group business entity PT Jiu Long Metal Industry for US$102.5 million.
  - PNBN: Reuters reported that the Gunawan family and ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. are considering a divestment of PNBN. The Gunawan family, which controls 46.52% of PNBN, and ANZ, which holds 39.22%, are the main shareholders.
November
  - TOBA: acquired 100% of waste management company Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. for S$405 million.
  - DOID: through its business entity signed an acquisition agreement for 51% of the Dawson Complex metallurgical coal mine for US$455 million.
  - ABMM: through its subsidiary signed an acquisition agreement for 99.9% of two subsidiaries of CTBN.
  - PACK: plans to rename itself Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama and change its business activity to a holding company in the nickel trading sector. PACK estimates that this change will increase net profit to IDR 346 million in 2025.
December
  - UNVR: signed a divestment agreement for its ice‑cream business worth IDR 7 trillion.
  - EXCL: announced a definitive agreement to merge with FREN, after which EXCL will be renamed XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera.
  - RAJA: its subsidiary Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU) plans an IPO of 20% of its shares at a price of IDR 900‑1,150 per share.
  - NCKL: acquired 10% of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt from an affiliate for about IDR 2.1 trillion.
  - KARW: the controlling shareholder sold approximately 5.4 million KARW shares at an average price of IDR 6,376 per share to broaden the retail investor base.
  - TPMA: together with KKGI established a joint venture named PT Trans Bahtera Pioneer.
  - MDIY: MR.D.I.Y operator Daya Intiguna Yasa conducted an IPO of 10% of its shares at a price of IDR 1,650 per share.

tickerNews.title: PANI private placement and IPO
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) rose 227% in 2024. In August the company conducted a private placement of IDR 6.5 trillion to acquire 239 hectares of land from an affiliated party. In December it announced the IPO of its subsidiary (CBDK) with a target fund raise of approximately IDR 1.7‑2.3 trillion.

tickerNews.title: INPC and JIHD returns linked to Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan)
tickerNews.content: Stocks affiliated with the Sugianto Kusuma (Aguan) conglomerate delivered strong returns in 2024: INPC increased by 193% and JIHD by 214%.

tickerNews.title: AMMN smelter inauguration
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN) rose 29% in 2024. In September the company inaugurated a smelter worth IDR 21 trillion with an input capacity of 900,000 tonnes of concentrate per year in West Nusa Tenggara.

tickerNews.title: BRMS higher grade gold reserves
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS) rose 104% in 2024. In December the company announced higher grade gold reserves at the River Reef and Hill Reel mines in Palu.

tickerNews.title: BUMI quasi‑reorganization plan
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources (BUMI) rose 39% in 2024. In April the company planned to seek approval for a quasi‑reorganization to eliminate a US$2.35 billion retained earnings deficit for 2023. The plan was later removed from the agenda of the extraordinary shareholders meeting in June 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTRO ownership increase and stock split
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) surged 426% in 2024. In June CUAN, through its subsidiary PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, increased its ownership by 7.5% of PTRO shares valued at approximately IDR 207.9 million from PT Caraka Reksa Optima. In December PTRO approved a 1:10 stock split, with the new nominal value to trade on the regular market and negotiations scheduled for 3 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: BREN FCA trading and index removal
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) rose 24% in 2024. In May the IDX set BREN trading to be conducted via a full periodic call auction (FCA). In September BREN entered the FTSE Global Equity Series – Large Cap index, but was later removed due to concentrated ownership, with four shareholders controlling 97% of the company.

tickerNews.title: TPIA joint venture with Glencore and index inclusion
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) rose 43% in 2024. In May the company announced that its joint venture with Glencore plc signed an agreement to acquire all shares of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore (SECP) from Shell Singapore Pte. Ltd. Also in May TPIA entered the MSCI Global Standard Indexes. In August TPIA Director Suryandi said the company is opening the opportunity to list its infrastructure subsidiary PT Chandra Daya Investasi.

tickerNews.title: MLPT, MLPL and LPKR returns for Grup Lippo
tickerNews.content: Shares linked to Grup Lippo delivered strong returns in 2024: MLPT increased by 1,078%, MLPL by 30%, and LPKR by 5%.

tickerNews.title: RAAM private placement investment
tickerNews.content: In September 2024 Grup MNC became an investor in a private placement of RAAM, acquiring 619.4 million (10%) shares valued at about IDR 310 million.

tickerNews.title: MSIN stock split
tickerNews.content: In October 2024 MSIN performed a 1:5 stock split.

tickerNews.title: KPIG land asset divestment
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 KPIG reached an agreement to divest the MNC Bali Resort land assets in Bali to PT Bumi Indah Prima for IDR 5.5 trillion.

tickerNews.title: DSSA stock split and GEMS return
tickerNews.content: DSSA performed a 1:10 stock split in July 2024. As a result, DSSA shares rose 363% in 2024, and GEMS shares increased by 83%.

tickerNews.title: ADRO spin‑off and AADI IPO
tickerNews.content: In September 2024 ADRO announced a spin‑off of its thermal coal business under AADI through a shareholders' public offering (PUPS). Simultaneously, AADI conducted an IPO in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: RAJA participation interest acquisition
tickerNews.content: In January 2024 RAJA, through its subsidiary, acquired an 8% participating interest in the Jabung block from PT GPI Jabung.

tickerNews.title: KARW share purchase and renaming
tickerNews.content: In January 2024 PT Saranakelola Investa purchased 80.19% of KARW shares from ICTSI Far East Limited Pte. Ltd. for about IDR 31 million. KARW was renamed Meratus Jasa Prima in May 2024.

tickerNews.title: INCO stake acquisition
tickerNews.content: In February 2024 state‑owned mining holding MIND ID acquired 14% of INCO shares at IDR 3,050 per share.

tickerNews.title: WIKA master restructuring agreement
tickerNews.content: In February 2024 WIKA reached a master restructuring agreement valued at IDR 24.79 trillion.

tickerNews.title: GGRM toll road concession
tickerNews.content: In February 2024 GGRM, through its subsidiary, obtained a 50‑year concession for the Kediri‑Tulungagung toll road, targeted to start operations in the third quarter of 2025.

tickerNews.title: UNTR geothermal acquisition plan
tickerNews.content: In March 2024 UNTR, through its subsidiary, planned to acquire geothermal company PT Supreme Energy Rantau Dedap for US$80.69 million.

tickerNews.title: FORU majority stake purchase
tickerNews.content: In March 2024 IMR Asia Holding acquired 77.7% of FORU shares for IDR 45.29 million.

tickerNews.title: ADHI, PTPP retained after BUMN Karya consolidation plan
tickerNews.content: In March 2024 the Minister of State‑Owned Enterprises announced a consolidation of BUMN Karya from seven companies into three, with ADHI, PTPP and PT Hutama Karya surviving the merger. The consolidation has not yet been realized, although it was initially planned to be completed by October 2024.

tickerNews.title: EMTK acquisition of CASS stake
tickerNews.content: In March 2024 EMTK, through its subsidiary, planned to acquire 41.15% of CASS shares for IDR 704.1 million. The transaction was completed in April 2024.

tickerNews.title: HRUM acquisition of Blue Sparkling Energy
tickerNews.content: In April 2024 HRUM, through its subsidiary, acquired 51% of Blue Sparkling Energy, a developer of an HPAL smelter expected to be operational in 2026, for approximately US$206.2 million. HRUM also signed a memorandum of understanding for strategic cooperation with Eternal Tsingshan Group Ltd.

tickerNews.title: SSIA land purchase by BYD
tickerNews.content: In April 2024 BYD announced the purchase of 108 hectares of land in the Subang Smartpolitan industrial area owned by SSIA. BYD had previously launched its products in Indonesia in early 2024.

tickerNews.title: PYFA acquisition of Probiotec Limited
tickerNews.content: In June 2024 PYFA, through its subsidiary, acquired all shares of Probiotec Limited for approximately AU$251 million, partially financed by a rights issue of about IDR 1 trillion in April 2024 and the remainder through bank debt.

tickerNews.title: TOWR acquisition of IBST
tickerNews.content: In July 2024 TOWR, through its subsidiary, acquired 90.11% of IBST for IDR 3.42 trillion.

tickerNews.title: JSMR divestment of Jasamarga Transjawa Tol
tickerNews.content: In July 2024 JSMR divested 35% of PT Jasamarga Transjawa Tol for US$960.3 million to a consortium of Metro Pacific Tollways Corp and GIC Pte. Ltd.

tickerNews.title: DOID acquisition of Atlantic Carbon Group
tickerNews.content: In July 2024 DOID, through its business entity, acquired the anthracite mining company Atlantic Carbon Group for US$122.4 million.

tickerNews.title: TPMA acquisition of Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah stake
tickerNews.content: In July 2024 TPMA acquired 65% of PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah from an affiliate for US$32.5 million, part of a rights issue of IDR 406.5 million in July 2024.

tickerNews.title: TOTL voluntary tender offer
tickerNews.content: In July 2024 Shimizu Corporation launched a voluntary tender offer for 19.9% of TOTL shares; no further update has been provided.

tickerNews.title: BKSL land purchase plan
tickerNews.content: In July 2024 Genting Plantations Bhd. planned to purchase 152 hectares of land from BKSL and a third party for about IDR 2 trillion.

tickerNews.title: BSDE planned acquisition of SMDM
tickerNews.content: In August 2024 BSDE planned to acquire 91.99% of SMDM for about IDR 2.4 trillion, with the transaction expected to close in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: DOID additional stake in 29Metals Ltd.
tickerNews.content: In August 2024 DOID, through its subsidiary, acquired 5.07% of 29Metals Ltd. for approximately AU$12.5 million.

tickerNews.title: FILM acquisition of NETV
tickerNews.content: In August 2024 FILM planned to acquire 80.05% of NETV for about IDR 1.7 trillion, with the transaction expected to close in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: BNBR equity deficit elimination
tickerNews.content: In August 2024 BNBR completed a quasi‑reorganization to eliminate an equity deficit of IDR 19.5 trillion.

tickerNews.title: ACES license agreement termination
tickerNews.content: In August 2024 ACES did not renew its licensing agreement with Ace Hardware Corporation, which will expire on 31 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: LABA cooperation with ECGO and land investment
tickerNews.content: In August 2024 LABA explored cooperation with electric motor manufacturer ECGO and planned to invest in land and buildings covering approximately 40 hectares.

tickerNews.title: LEAD private placement for debt conversion
tickerNews.content: In October 2024 LEAD conducted a private placement to convert US$20 million of debt.

tickerNews.title: ENRG acquisition of Sengkang Block participation
tickerNews.content: In October 2024 ENRG, through its subsidiary, signed an acquisition agreement for a 51% participation right in the Sengkang Block, South Sulawesi.

tickerNews.title: ANTM acquisition of Tsingshan Group stake
tickerNews.content: In October 2024 ANTM, through its subsidiary, acquired 30% of the Tsingshan Group business entity PT Jiu Long Metal Industry for US$102.5 million.

tickerNews.title: PNBN potential divestment discussion
tickerNews.content: In October 2024 Reuters reported that the Gunawan family and ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. are considering a divestment of PNBN. The Gunawan family controls 46.52% of PNBN, while ANZ holds 39.22% of the shares.

tickerNews.title: TOBA acquisition of Sembcorp Environment
tickerNews.content: In November 2024 TOBA acquired 100% of waste management company Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. for S$405 million.

tickerNews.title: DOID acquisition of Dawson Complex stake
tickerNews.content: In November 2024 DOID, through its business entity, signed an acquisition agreement for 51% of the Dawson Complex metallurgical coal mine for US$455 million.

tickerNews.title: ABMM acquisition of CTBN subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: In November 2024 ABMM, through its subsidiary, signed an acquisition agreement for 99.9% of two subsidiaries of CTBN.

tickerNews.title: PACK renaming and business shift
tickerNews.content: In November 2024 PACK plans to rename itself Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama and change its business activity to a holding company in the nickel trading sector. PACK estimates that this change will increase net profit to IDR 346 million in 2025.

tickerNews.title: UNVR ice‑cream business divestment
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 UNVR signed a divestment agreement for its ice‑cream business worth IDR 7 trillion.

tickerNews.title: EXCL merger with FREN
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 EXCL announced a definitive agreement to merge with FREN, after which EXCL will be renamed XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera.

tickerNews.title: RAJA IPO plan for Raharja Energi Cepu
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 RAJA's subsidiary Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU) plans an IPO of 20% of its shares at a price of IDR 900‑1,150 per share.

tickerNews.title: NCKL acquisition of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt stake
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 NCKL acquired 10% of PT Obi Nickel Cobalt from an affiliate for about IDR 2.1 trillion.

tickerNews.title: KARW share sale to broaden retail base
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 the controlling shareholder of KARW sold approximately 5.4 million KARW shares at an average price of IDR 6,376 per share to broaden the retail investor base.

tickerNews.title: TPMA and KKGI joint venture establishment
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 TPMA, together with KKGI, established a joint venture named PT Trans Bahtera Pioneer.

tickerNews.title: MDIY IPO of 10% shares
tickerNews.content: In December 2024 MDIY, the operator of MR.D.I.Y, conducted an IPO of 10% of its shares at a price of IDR 1,650 per share.
